definition[0]: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh
example[0]: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
definition[1]: to behave or operate in exactly the same way as something or someone else
example[2]: Europe should not try to mimic Japan: we have to find our own path to successful modernisation.
example[3]: The drug mimics the action of the body’s own chemicals.
definition[2]: if an animal mimics something, it looks or sounds very like it
example[4]: a fly whose size and colour exactly mimics that of the wasp
definition[3]: a person or animal that is good at copying the movements, sound, or appearance of someone or something else
